title: Would the Romans have considered the Carthaginians 'barbarians'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since the Punic language spoken by Carthaginians is unintelligible to a Latin or Greek speaker, if “barbarian” still had its original meaning, the Carthaginians would have been barbarians. If the change to mean people with a primitive culture had already taken place, the Romans would have called them barbarians for sacrificing their children to the god Baal when they faced an emergency.
